2.segment: COVID‐19 has heightened the dependence of urban dwellers on cultural ecosystem services provided by urban green spaces ( UGS ) ,

3.segment: specifically in regard to the provision of recreational opportunities ,

4.segment: and psychological and physical health benefits arising from their use .

6.segment: As different types and levels of cultural ecosystem services are provided by different types of UGS ,

7.segment: people may seek out different UGS to satisfy personal needs over various phases of COVID‐19 mobility restrictions imposed by cities .

8.segment: We report on a study that took advantage of the different phases of COVID‐19 mobility restrictions to assess the demand for and perception of different types of UGS in Singapore .

10.segment: The study utilised four datasets to compare demand for and visitorship patterns of UGS before the pandemic ( Pre‐Circuit Breaker ) ,

11.segment: the duration of the strictest mobility restrictions ( Circuit Breaker ) ,

12.segment: and after the measures were relaxed ( Post‐Circuit Breaker ) .

13.segment: We used Google Search trends as a proxy for UGS demand ,

14.segment: Google mobility data for an overview of population visitorship trends ,

15.segment: visitor counts for granular insights on actual visitorship trends ,

16.segment: and qualitative data on perception of parks by park visitors after restrictions eased .

17.segment: Parks were categorised as manicured and less manicured UGS for analysis .

19.segment: Search interest for UGS overall fell by more than 50 % from during Circuit Breaker but the post‐Circuit Breaker levels exceeded pre‐Circuit Breaker ,

20.segment: with a 70.9 % increase for less manicured UGS compared to 20.8 % for manicured UGS .

21.segment: This corroborated with Google mobility and visitor counts ,

22.segment: which showed a steep decrease in park use followed by a rapid increase in the same periods ,

23.segment: and with increased visitorship in the less manicured UGS .

24.segment: The perception study also showed that more than 50 % of respondents reported visiting parks that they have never visited before ,

25.segment: and there was a greater appreciation and use of UGS after the pandemic and preference for less manicured and more naturalistic landscapes .

27.segment: The pandemic has heightened the demand for cultural ecosystem services provided by UGS .

28.segment: Our study showed that this demand is not uniform across different types of UGS ,

29.segment: with an increase visitorship and preference for less manicured green spaces .

30.segment: Read the free Plain Language Summary for this article on the Journal blog .
